plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A popular autumn-flowering garden plant known for its large, showy blooms in a variety of colors including yellow, white, pink, and red. Chrysanthemums are widely cultivated and are considered symbols of autumn in many cultures.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide (commonly found in North America, Europe, and East Asia)
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums originate from East Asia and have been cultivated for over 2,500 years, symbolizing longevity and rejuvenation in Chinese and Japanese cultures.

plants.name: Gaillardia pulchella
plants.description: A hardy wildflower with bright red and yellow daisy-like petals that bloom profusely in late summer through fall. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is native to North America.
plants.location: Central and Southern United States, Mexico
plants.funFact: The vibrant coloration of Gaillardia flowers attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a great plant for ecological gardening.

plants.name: Nicotiana alata
plants.description: A fragrant, tubular flower that blooms in late summer and fall. It emits a sweet scent in the evening to attract moth pollinators and is often used in ornamental gardens.
plants.location: Originally native to South America; widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Nicotiana alataâ€™s scent intensifies at night, an adaptation to attract nocturnal pollinators like hawk moths.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree that produces striking bright orange to red spider-like flowers in spring through fall. It is both an ornamental and timber tree species.
plants.location: Eastern Australia and cultivated in subtropical and tropical regions
plants.funFact: Silky Oak flowers are rich in nectar and attract a variety of birds, especially honeyeaters, playing an important role in local ecosystems.
